reviews.review_msg: his class is very interesting, he encourage everyoen in class to talk, every student larn something for sure after taking his course and i am the one

Fred seems like a great person who is genuinely trying his best, but his lectures were just so boring that it is hard to call him a great prof. The course was not hard, but it is heavily reliant on group projects. There is a lot of discussion that takes place, during both the lectures and the tutorials. Overall great person, ok prof, ok class.
I have taken CMNS 110, 210 and 354 with Roman. He is awesome. The mid-term is quite fair. I would definitely recommend his class.
he is willing to answer any question clearly, he gives a very fare assignmnt and mid-term, he explains the theories in a easier way so that students can undertand quite well.

I've taken CMNS 110, 210, and 354 with Roman. I had to say I learned a lot in 110 and 210, even though I always find the survey assignments to be on the tricky side as he is somewhat ambiguous in what he wants, but I always found him interesting. However, there is a point where his ambiguity and off-topic stories becomes a little too much.

He is one of the smartest profs in the fac. His professional experience is unparalleled. Easy to approach and very colloquial. He tends however to do his lectures on the fly and is  fairly unorganized. His lectures are always interesting and often leads to intense and thought provoking discussion. Take him to learn, not if you just want the grade.

Don't listen to the first years, they don't know much about CMNS or university teaching yet. They will later find out, Roman is one of the best profs you'll ever have, and very democratic...but he'll work your ass off, no doubt about that.
One of the best lecturers in the CMNS dept....he made the boring material interesting.  Assignments weren't too hard...and marking was pretty easy =)
